synopsis: In episode #9, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome guest Vivek Menon for a lively discussion about creativity, identity, and filmmaking. Vivek shares his journey of producing the series 'New Normal' alongside his father, emphasizing the importance of expression and the learning process in the world of art and storytelling.
quotes: You can't be afraid to put your stuff out there; if you spend so much time and effort making something, you should be proud to share it.
The best way of learning is by doing it and putting yourself out there.
If there's something that has been on the back of your mind that you've always wanted to do, just throw yourself into it.
Your experience and your voice are the most unique things you can write.
It's completely internal; I do not think like a single person will ever judge you as harshly as you judge yourself.
Success is not just about being a big name; it's about continuously being able to tell the stories you want to tell.
The idea of success can be redefined; it's about what you make of your journey.
You should call yourself a filmmaker; if you are making films, you are one.
Passion isn't something you have; it's something that develops through practice.
Sometimes the worst thing in the world is not about the content you create but about not creating anything at all.
